title: How to Draw a Rubber Duck

steps.headline: Draw a circle.
steps.description: This will be your rubber ducky's head. It doesn't have to be perfect, but try to be neat!

steps.headline: Draw the tail.
steps.description: Draw a pointed oval shape directly under the circle, this will be the duck's tail. Draw a small circle for the eye.

steps.headline: Connect the head to the body with two small lines, broaden the duck's chest, and add the beak.
Make the wings.
steps.description: Add an oval inside the duck's body. This will be the wing. The left side should be larger than the right.

steps.headline: Add the feathers.
steps.description: Draw the duck's wings and erase any unnecessary guidelines. When done, yours should look like this: The wings can be detailed even more by making a curly cue at the end of the feathers,

steps.headline: Add a background.Why not add some bathwater and soap bubbles to your rubber ducky drawing?
steps.description: This will make it appealing to the eye.

steps.headline: Color it.
steps.description: Add color as no rubber ducky is complete without color!

tyn: Crayons, paints, colored pencils, and/ or markers.
text: Draw a circle. This will be your rubber ducky's head. It doesn't have to be perfect, but try to be neat! Draw the tail. Draw a pointed oval shape directly under the circle, this will be the duck's tail. Draw a small circle for the eye. Connect the head to the body with two small lines, broaden the duck's chest, and add the beak.  Make the wings. Add an oval inside the duck's body. This will be the wing. The left side should be larger than the right. Add the feathers. Draw the duck's wings and erase any unnecessary guidelines. When done, yours should look like this: The wings can be detailed even more by making a curly cue at the end of the feathers, Add a background.Why not add some bathwater and soap bubbles to your rubber ducky drawing? This will make it appealing to the eye. Color it. Add color as no rubber ducky is complete without color!
sentences: This will be your rubber ducky's head.
It doesn't have to be perfect, but try to be neat!
Draw a pointed oval shape directly under the circle, this will be the duck's tail.
Draw a small circle for the eye.
Connect the head to the body with two small lines, broaden the duck's chest, and add the beak.
Add an oval inside the duck's body.
The left side should be larger than the right.
Draw the duck's wings and erase any unnecessary guidelines.

When done, yours should look like this: The wings can be detailed even more by making a curly cue at the end of the feathers, Add a background.Why not add some bathwater and soap bubbles to your rubber ducky drawing?
This will make it appealing to the eye.
Add color as no rubber ducky is complete without color!
